intro: Hieracium fissuricola, commonly known as the fissured hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium fissuricola is often found in crevices and on slopes, where it forms dense mats, contributing to soil stabilization in its habitat.
